channel.title: Life on Iman Tumorang
channel.description: Recent content in Life on Iman Tumorang

item.title: How Bad is My First Code in Backend Production when Working as a Software Engineer
item.description: The story of mine, that taught me the important of code review. It happen when my first year in my first company as an Software Engineer. That was my first time to write a big task for the backend side. That was creating a cron-job that will work to migrate data based on our customer data. The original task is easy. If drawn in a picture The task is, we provide some of safe option to our customer.

item.title: Programming as a Passion vs Programming as a Job
item.description: Based on my experiences with my personal opinion and thought When we were still in college, we always demanded for studying hard. Having a good score in every class and also active in social community, club or something. I remember when I was still in college, I always trying not to fail in my class. Also, I’m joining a club, a community by students. A geek one, it’s called “Programming Club”.

item.title: An Opinion-based : Advices to Junior Programmer
item.description: My honest opinion how to survive being a Junior Programmer Being junior is a bit scary. It’s like too many things that we must know and learn. The system, the teams, the new technology, and everything. Currently, I can said, I’m a junior in my office. But time by the time, my task increased and more deep. At the beginning I just instructed to code something, then report to my team lead.

item.title: How can I ever be a shit as a software developer
item.description: And what I can learned and improve by being a shit. Become software developer is not a title, but it’s a responsibilities we must faced. When it’s not good, then say no, otherwise say yes. Don’t be the sh*t programmer. Surprised by the Unexpected Things On my second grade when still in college, a few years ago. I got a chance to work as intern in One of government office as an software developer interns.

item.title: What I Learn from Working in Small Startup as A Fresh Graduate
item.description: Hey , my name is Iman Syahputra Situmorang, a Fullstack Software Engineer in Bornevia. I just start working for 6 months. A valuable 6 months to learn what is the feel when working in a small Start Up . Well it will be a shocking news, about the closing of bornevia.com. But I will not telling anything about the reason of bornevia’s closing, I’m just telling what I learn from Bornevia when I work over there.
